document.title: World Languages WL21 (WL20A/B) Spanish Level I

8E8C05BEE5084721BCBC872AE3503018.description:
sometimes describe where they
work and what they do in L2.

616E930F270846929579832FEAC7E7AA.description:
use memorized and practiced
vocabulary and structures in the
target language to access and
interact with different media and
community resources within and
beyond the school setting.

C7BAF88544E24D67980ED3BE186CD693.description:
Participate in simple
activities and cultural events
within the school setting
(and beyond, as applicable).

4FFF6AD2E2514E23882A9644B234DB93.description:
Novice: Communicate using
keywords and phrases in the
target language within the
school setting (and beyond,
as applicable).

979047E8E8524CB0AE22BF1F1D1F0BDA.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a simple
sentence.

52CB0CF58E5848FB912B398803105CBD.description:
Communities (COM):
Use the target language to participate in the community and in the globalized world, for enjoyment, enrichment, and
advancement.

462C0C6D9BCF4666930F2FE4D5C0CB1D.description:
compare historical information,
cultural aspects, and celebrations
from the target culture with their
own in L1.

ACA4EDDFCE8E4999BFA98A8C6247F2CF.description:
compare some grammatical
structure, words, and meanings of
the target language with their own
language in L1.

A7F33D7C8526471DA06A0E64CA2F3C98.description:
Identify and compare
products and practices (e.g.,
celebrations, dances, oral
stories, food) typical of the
target culture with his/her
own culture (as applicable).

E656A3A3242943DBAEA8CCA8462E511D.description:
Novice: Recognize and compare
words, true and false
cognates, sound patterns,
and basic grammatical
structures of the target
language with his/her own
language (as applicable).

56FAF46ADD3E4BD4A1AFC3BD69DDC61D.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a
simple sentence.

5F157B5245524056B2600018F3205F2C.description:
Comparisons (COMP):
Use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the nature of language and the concept of culture through comparisons of
the target language and cultures studied to one’s own.

D817FE3EA4D443CAA0342BF927D6D39F.description:
identify healthy nutritional
categories, simple labels on a
science related graph, artists, titles,
genres, and categories on any
graph.

CC57F0788ACB49519693F2D513C2117A.description:
list the main cities of a specific
country and locate places on maps.

4F54302582F94D4785734DC62D9E3C69.description:
label familiar people, places, and
objects in pictures and posters.

FD42493494214903AD911577D33D9600.description:
Novice: Identify and use familiar
vocabulary and phrases in
the target language
supported by resources
(e.g., maps, graphs, visuals,
audio, digital media) to
reinforce prior knowledge
and make connections to
new knowledge of familiar
topics in other content
areas (e.g., geography,
history, arts, math, science).

B47D970352604715AE5A437A4F6A119F.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a
simple sentence.

45DD7D1978234945BD78965A7D3BFE4E.description:
Connections (CON):
Build, reinforce, and expand knowledge of other content areas and evaluate information and diverse perspectives while using the
target language to develop critical thinking and creative problem solving.

CC58FC2486E347CBAC0D27F3BC341CD7.description:
handle short interactions with peers
and colleagues in familiar situations
at school, work, or play.
recognize and refer to elements of
traditional and pop culture in L1.

C40620CD65824A2F976FCCAA157F5469.description:
make some generalizations about a
culture mostly in L1.

BA099D158F7F4FA3AC4B98D274FD277D.description:
describe some basic cultural
viewpoints mostly in L1.

CE6ADBCED52E45E7BDF965AF946DF5E1.description:
compare and contrast some
behaviors or practices of other
cultures and their own mostly in L1.

E1D0D4E33EE348F3A698E25869A2D731.description:
explore and reference current and
past examples of authentic culture
mostly in L1.

5BBC9D4959DE4749878DDE31C253A954.description:
compare and contrast some
common products of other cultures
and their own mostly in L1.

4F18478B5F0F48A8A95590ED9DA891FF.description:
Novice: Participate in
age­appropriate and
culturally authentic
activities such as
celebrations, songs, games,and dances; recognize
products of culture (e.g.,
food, shelter, clothing,
transportation, toys).

A97F8840E21442D4BB0A6AA0E067068C.description:
Novice: Recognize basic practices,
products, and perspectives
of cultures where the target
language is spoken (e.g.,
greetings, holiday
celebrations, body
language, gestures, and
traditions).

B8580207F36641F6B262991444CE2A7C.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a
simple sentence.

E07755E73CC54EC0819CB391C74B305F.description:
Cultures (CUL):
Use the target language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices, products, and perspectives
of cultures studied.

23CFCA4682D44C808C21361BC56B217F.description:
write about a familiar experience or
event using practiced material.

AF497F5564744595AD63B7AA1B69544F.description:
write short notes using phrases and
simple sentences.

EE8A7ECF294B4662A0AE4CE6F912302D.description:
write notes about something they
have learned using lists, phrases,
and memorized expressions.
write information about their daily
life in a letter, blog, discussion
board, or email message.

2EA28DA4FC884789A70C02110840D43F.description:
list their daily activities and write
lists that help in their day­to­day
life.

D700C40D108942B0B30613CD38FD3968.description:
write about themselves using
learned phrases and memorized
expressions.

7F80B63E3FBB4FF699848C035FA82C64.description:
fill out a simple form with some
basic personal information.

0F10372E3D9A4FADB461545371905625.description:
label familiar people, places, and
objects in pictures and posters.

285B3CD52BA94C97A29B4137F2E3A0CA.description:
write words and phrases that have
been learned.

A09C560FDBB144018964BA73E93E4143.description:
copy some characters or letters and
words they see on the wall or
board, in a book, or on the
computer.

D3A7D899594D43F8985EC27E87D62ED8.description:
Novice High: Write short messages and
notes using phrases and
simple sentences on topics
related to everyday life.

6CD1EC0D8FC44BF1967CD595E752D4D2.description:
Novice Mid: Write lists and practiced
phrases on familiar topics.

386DDD0858B74A6AB314DCFD05BFA5B1.description:
Novice Low: Copy some familiar
words, characters, or
phrases.

38B4C57366F3415C964FE3FBB0794282.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a
simple sentence.

318A055E488A420F8E9AFC574EBF959D.description:
Presentational Writing (PW):
Present information, concepts, and ideas to inform, explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media
and adapting to various audiences of readers or viewers.

3F5491064D5241A3BB60C07537A2EB37.description:
present information about others
using phrases and simple sentences.

225E7E2CF05D4278BB66F0015DE4539A.description:
present basic information about a
familiar person, place, or thing using
phrases and simple sentences.

37FF1BADCCD3408EA80CBFA1D811065F.description:
tell about a familiar experience or
event using phrases and simple
sentences.

D6743E59D7FC4EEE9F1EAA2C6BB18537.description:
present information about their life
using phrases and simple sentences.

D78491EE46A34C2F96956AF931DB5C28.description:
present simple information about
something learned using words,
phrases, and memorized
expressions.

8D36E0C6BB7845E3826EECF649503E98.description:
present information about familiar
items in their immediate
environment.
talk about their daily activities using
words, phrases, and memorized
expressions.

15901CC00B254034ACB6E79EAB7FCAD6.description:
express likes and dislikes using
words, phrases, and memorized
expressions.

11B4AAC3BAEA40D695A307DD8FCD86F6.description:
present information about
themselves and others using words
and phrases.

0A8896B80EA24DC19E077F1DED7F0FED.description:
state the names of familiar people,
places, and objects in pictures and
posters using words or memorized
phrases.

C436865EA54A49ABADE6658EC0CF9DC1.description:
recite short memorized phrases,
parts of poems, rhymes, words, and
phrases that have been learned.

EE71797EFD1A49EF9D2FC9A2EBF51A84.description:
Novice High: Present basic information
on familiar topics using
learned phrases and simple
sentences.

DDF9C4CA8AFC4016AAAF76A1F7611CDA.description:
Novice Mid: Present information
about self and some other
familiar topics using a
variety of words, phrases,
and practiced expressions.

ED398CF0FA2745918B69C2EBA36F2325.description:
Novice Low: Present information
about self and other familiar
topics using single words or
practiced phrases.

875B734C227A4556935D1D75A69B2755.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a
simple sentence.

015FD647302C4E29A251D2B39051B08C.description:
Presentational Speaking (PS):
Present information, concepts, and ideas to inform, explain, persuade, and narrate on a variety of topics using appropriate media
and adapting to various audiences of listeners or viewers.

449050F2A2BC46F4B8E94EDFFFAEBD87.description:
identify some information from
news media.

7CD82B4F935D469DB9FE716CA9FB27C0.description:
identify some simple information
needed on forms.

29A9E889F21343EEA4957EE578D14A3B.description:
understand messages in which the
writer tells or asks about topics of
personal interest.

810392BEEB0840D9BC3E14D2E6B2E658.description:
understand simple, every day
notices in public places on topics
that are familiar.

DDD0B4579D7A4834ACB9415973B81737.description:
sometimes understand the main
idea of published materials.

D024BBCAC1E94D7B801C1C9520D0E39D.description:
usually understand short simple
messages on familiar topics with the
help of pictures or graphs.

2A66E74821F340A09060B49D78BD8BB1.description:
connect some words, phrases, or
characters to their meanings.

D255012CA12847F9BA32D8B4EC76825C.description:
recognize a few letters,
characters, words, and phrases.

0C1675CDD1E141A5A95918EEC6824277.description:
Intermediate
Low: Understand the main idea
of short and simple texts
when the topic is familiar.

34C627FAA73B47DB86D0B943EAC2CD12.description:
Can create with
language, ask and
answer, simple
questions on
familiar topics, and
handle a simple
situation or
transaction.

3B2E5E26B82947A4AC588B3B09D76730.description:
Novice High: Understand familiar
words, phrases, sentences,
and sometimes the main
idea within short and simple
texts related to everyday
life.

6CF1AAEA2F304C338D25D4AF4B167AE1.description:
Novice Mid: Recognize and
understand some
characters, words, and
phrases.

84663758D88D4C808DABFA1FAEED7C93.description:
Novice Low: Recognize a few letters or
characters and learned
words or phrases.

7D5FDFF5D56D4AC8896DB62362ACA1FB.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a simple
sentence.

26497B5051D342EEB1449C9BD7CCB39D.description:
Interpretive Reading (IR):
Understand, interpret, and analyze what is read or viewed on a variety of topics.

9388C14DB88448BB854876251A0311E6.description:
understand simple information when presented with pictures and
graphs.

3A3928DC66A1461B8128B70638E3B06D.description:
sometimes understand simple
questions or statements on familiar
topics and the main topic of
conversations overheard.

77F1E80BDD8C480684F4AD0402585220.description:
recognize and sometimes
understand basic information in
words and phrases that have been
memorized or learned for specific
purposes.

1A1CBB62CDCD4D409126F9CF1C558D6F.description:
understand isolated words that are
memorized, particularly when
accompanied by gestures or
pictures.

7E278C68DE474F9F9D18B2A8CAA7B675.description:
occasionally identify the sound of a
character or a word.

65B5B155E94D4CCA88834B0C8C5ED634.description:
Novice High: Understand words,
phrases, and simple
sentences related to
everyday life; sometimes
understand the main topic
of what is heard.

590F02ABC3674E6AABD7633C803BE416.description:
Novice Mid: Recognize some familiar
words and phrases.

6E7CBCCB30AE4386B2295B4C0BA75EA6.description:
Novice Low: Recognize a few familiar
words or phrases.

3425235DDE7B4F2D83E1319B7B6CE619.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a simple
sentence.

C639A595BE2543CB9F13D715397CC04F.description:
Interpretive Listening (IL):
Understand, interpret, and analyze what is heard (communicated in ASL) on a variety of topics.

95D56BD3A3BA41878FFEDDD092A87B39.description:
make plans and interact with others
in everyday situations.

5321123E12FB41D08CA4104F79C1A0FD.description: ask for and give simple directions.

A831ADA8D4674D47B98387A14BD3CF1C.description:
exchange information using texts,
graphs, or pictures.

BD41F66833804EF792B59958EC4D6A8B.description:
communicate basic information
about themselves and people they
know, and their everyday life.

584BF60CF9624441A14C5C2BA1D68082.description:
make some simple statements in a
conversation.

F8E89B8ADDCF4EBE964688172D407DB5.description:
ask and answer a variety of simple
questions.

580A0FB225B94D9C91CB7ADBF19B1104.description:
introduce themselves and others
and exchange some personal
information.

D1F69AE8B3FC47C58C090B57062C4250.description: greet people in a polite way.

9F39743B6EE34DF0A37C317999B0F4B0.description:
Novice High: Carry out short social
interactions in everyday
situations by asking and
answering simple questions.

1D10F840ACC44E729D2D9DB1D307D2BC.description:
Novice High: Communicate and
exchange information about
familiar topics using phrases
and simple sentences.

17A8D2D45D884954B9C0DC9407619260.description:
Novice Mid: Communicate on very
familiar topics using a
variety of words and
phrases that have been
practiced and learned.

0C49BB3EA37745D3903D83123B88A37E.description:
Novice Low: Communicate on some
very familiar topics using
single words and phrases
that have been practiced
and learned.

75A6B0AA829E41DD8958664AA99E36FA.description:
Can communicate
using memorized
materials in the
form of
words/characters,
phrases, or a simple
sentence.

F009FC3BFEE541B1998A37A5025631CB.description:
Interpersonal Communication (IC):
Interact and negotiate meaning in spoken, written, or signed conversations to share information, reactions, feelings, and opinions.

9F9F0CFF60B04613BAED3D6F16ECA412.description:
May use culturally appropriate gestures and formulaic expressions in highly practiced application. May show awareness of
the most obvious cultural differences or prohibitions, but may often miss cues indicating miscommunication.

CEE60236EFE042928C8D0546C64BF882.description: May use some or all of the following strategies to maintain communication:

C9490AEC255E483BB09EDF54CA06BE12.description: Able to understand and produce a number of high frequency words, highly practiced expressions, and formulaic questions.

B8C0BDB1580D4D9084EB9415E8475A0E.description:
Can usually comprehend highly practiced and basic messages when supported by visual or contextual clues, redundancy or
restatement, and when the message contains familiar structures.
Can control memorized language sufficiently to be appropriate to the context and understood, at times with difficulty, by
those accustomed to dealing with language learners.

0DBD7C3FCB0B486DB215B37203D2D6E8.description:
Understands and produces highly practiced words and phrases and an occasional sentence. Able to ask formulaic or
memorized questions.

1557F8A1599D46B0BF1A0A27EACF2D7F.description:
Creates messages in some personally relevant contexts on topics that relate to basic biographical information.
May show emerging evidence of the ability to create messages in highly practiced contexts related to oneself and immediate
environment.

8D4033C131E64B1C89DBCE1841CEDDC9.description:
Presents simple, basic information on very familiar topics by producing words, lists, notes and formulaic language using highly
practiced language.
May show emerging evidence of the ability to express own thoughts and preferences.

98B555C46C40446E92E02EF709CDC0C1.description: Communicates information on very familiar topics using a variety of words, phrases, and sentences that have been practiced and memorized.

281A4C2CE9934B769E331594118EA98B.description: ACTFL PERFORMANCE DESCRIPTORS FOR LEVEL I LANGUAGE LEARNERS – PRESENTATIONAL

07CC8B712C48456EAFF40678347C3A24.description:
May use culturally appropriate gestures and formulaic expressions in highly practiced application. May show awareness of the
most obvious cultural differences or prohibitions, but may often miss cues indicating miscommunication.

702D9B80E0B64A769ECAA01097C367EB.description: May use some or all of the following strategies to maintain communication:

5925046F247C4ACE8D276E46C8EE2C4B.description: Able to understand and produce a number of high frequency words, highly practiced expressions, and formulaic questions.

D90325CBA50844A99C966E07B1FC4561.description:
Can usually comprehend highly practiced and basic messages when supported by visual or contextual clues, redundancy or
restatement, and when the message contains familiar structures.
Can control memorized language sufficiently to be appropriate to the context and understood, at times with difficulty, by
those accustomed to dealing with language learners.

AE5BDE9E89DB46BC9766124F6187B480.description:
Understands and produces highly practiced words and phrases and an occasional sentence. Able to ask formulaic or
memorized questions.

CE666F0D780A43729F7D149E03333E48.description:
Able to function in some personally relevant contexts on topics that relate to basic biographical information.
May show emerging evidence of the ability to communicate in highly practiced contexts related to oneself and immediate
environment.

B281A15B40CC46238D0B9E7FC20DCB9E.description:
Can ask highly predictable and formulaic questions and respond to such questions by listing, naming, and identifying.
May show emerging evidence of the ability to engage in simple conversation.

1F3072AB10904108A87CA272B49BEF51.description:
Expresses self in conversations on very familiar topics using a variety of words, phrases, simple sentences, and questions that have been highly
practiced and memorized.

8EDB55134FE04EDAB47E48E9BD73A7FF.description: ACTFL PERFORMANCE DESCRIPTORS FOR LEVEL I LANGUAGE LEARNERS – INTERPERSONAL

D6E77D1AC04A4D61BE952CC14B29CF45.description:
May use culturally appropriate gestures and formulaic expressions in highly practiced application. May show awareness of the
most obvious cultural differences or prohibitions, but may often miss cues indicating miscommunication.

865787ED939B441085C96DDB92C4CE48.description: May recognize word family roots, prefixes and suffixes

DCB34A23974B42209BE6BAC26E7B34C1.description: Predict meaning based on context, prior knowledge, and/or experience

84B4E7155FE843E19D1FC2BFD29D2AD1.description: Rely on visual support and background knowledge

EE14C4DDFF524E1C9EAFA43BB23FBFEF.description: May use some or all of the following strategies to comprehend texts:

0B138F8AE4EE48D68D18D1D030138A72.description:
Sometimes comprehends some highly predictable vocabulary, a limited number of words related to familiar topics, and
formulaic expressions.

A667A7EE12AD4213B684DD681E3A61A8.description:
Primarily relies on vocabulary to derive meaning from texts.
May derive meaning by recognizing structural patterns that have been used in familiar and some new contexts.

47774AEA072B4222A7B94BAD84AABC96.description:
Derives meaning when authentic texts (listening, reading, or viewing) are supported by visuals or when the topic is very
familiar.
Comprehends texts ranging in length from lists, to phrases, to simple sentences, often with graphically organized information.

AADF03D847B041E4A89E3F748EFF3050.description:
Comprehends texts with highly predictable, familiar contexts (those related to personal background, prior knowledge, or
experiences).

77DD2E43BD1F485DB52D48C849B10895.description:
Comprehends meaning through recognition of key words and formulaic phrases that are highly contextualized.
May show emerging evidence of the ability to make inferences based on background and prior knowledge.

7F70E00724CC4BA9BDDAA5932270392F.description:
Understands words, phrases, and formulaic language that have been practiced and memorized to get meaning of the main idea from simple, highly
predictable oral or written texts, with strong visual support.

5DEEF9837D874C79BFEAAC39B36EE677.description: ACTFL PERFORMANCE DESCRIPTORS FOR LEVEL I LANGUAGE LEARNERS – INTERPRETIVE
